revised_title: Seiches and Tidal Ringing in the Sea Near Shetland: A Study of Coastal Waves and Their Causes
tldr: This study investigates seiches and tidal ringing in the sea near Shetland, analyzing medium-frequency waves from tide gauges and sea-bed pressure. The authors suggest that the east Shetland coast acts as a diffraction grating for long waves, trapping them in a pattern of standing edge waves concentrated in the coastal zone. The occurrence of these waves is associated with the passage of fast-moving meteorological fronts across the northern North Sea.
